notesStmt.note: Rubrics on fols. 80v, 150r-151r, and 154r are in Dutch; first three and final three flyleaves are modern paper; remainder are parchment

msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This manuscript is a Book of Hours for the Use of Rome produced in Flanders in the third quarter of the fifteenth century. It contains twenty three-to-seven-line historiated initials and three full-page miniatures by a follower of William Vrelant, one of which is an unusual depiction of the heraldic Arma Christi supported by Christ and the Virgin Mary (fol. 92r). The rubrics on fols. 80v, 150r-151r, and 154r are in Dutch.

msItem.title: Book of Hours, Use of Rome
Prayers to the Virgin, beginning with Virgo templum trinitatis (rubric in Dutch)
Prayer to the Virgin, O sanctissima, o dulcissima
Prayers to female Saints: Katherine, Margaret, and Barbara
Prayers beginning with Domine sancte pater
Prayer, Domine ihesu christe filii dei vivi redemptor mundi
Prayers to the Lord for the Parts of the Body
Prayer for the Elevation of the Host
Prayers, beginning with O bone Ihesu
Legend of the 10,000 martyrs (rubrics in Dutch)

supportDesc.extent: vii+165+vii; 163 x 110 mm bound to 172 x 127 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto; the three tipped-in miniatures have additional lower right recto foliation in pencil

layoutDesc.layout: One column of eighteen lines; ruled in purple ink; written area: 107 x 72 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Three full-page miniatures; twenty historiated initials; red, blue, and gold decorated initials and line fillers throughout
21rFull-page miniature, Virgin and Child enthroned with Saints Catherine, Mary Magdalene, Justina, and Barbara
50vHistoriated initial D, Annunciation to the Shepherds
54vHistoriated initial D, Adoration of the Magi
58rHistoriated initial D, Presentation in the Temple
61vHistoriated initial D, Massacre of the Innocents
76rFull-page miniature, Pietà with John and Mary Magdalene
92rFull-page miniature, Arma Christi supported by Christ and the Virgin, surrounded by Evangelist Symbols and surmounted by Hand of God
92rMarginal scene, Angels with Instruments of the Passion
142rHistoriated initial O, Christ with a Book
154vHistoriated initial D, Martyrdom of Saint Eustace and his Companions
159vMarginal scene, Female grotesque with a mirror
162vHistoriated initial S, Saint Macarius of Ghent

binding.p: Early-nineteenth-century French black calf; elaborately gold-tooled decoration on front and back covers, spine, and inside covers; red satin doublures; gilt and gauffered edges; metal clasp; stamped in gold on spine: "HORAE BEATAE MARIAE VIRGINIS" and "1430"

history.provenance: Gilbert sale, Philadelphia, 7 June 1909; Given by John Frederick Lewis's widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936.
